statement.p: In Biology class, students store their specimen's for labs at -29 ˚C. To thaw, a specimen is brought to a refrigeration unit. After 1 hour, the specimen's temperature in the refrigeration unit is -20 ˚C.
a. Sketch a graph to model the situation.
b. Calculate the rate of change. m = degrees per hour
c. The y-intercept is . What does it represent in this situation?

ol.li: The temperature goes up 29 degrees per hour.
The specimen starts at 29 degrees below zero.
It takes 29 minutes to warm up.
